The intuition is that a trade deficit (X - M < 0) means that the right-hand side must
also be negative so that the total savings (private savings + government savings) is less
than domestic investment in physical capital. The additional amount to fund domestic
investment must come from foreigners, so there is a surplus in the capital account to
offset the deficit in the trade account. Another thing we can see from this identity is
that any government deficit not funded by an excess of domestic saving over domestic
investment is consistent with a trade deficit (imports > exports) which is offset by an
inflow of foreign capital (a surplus in the capital account).
